column4: i've change setting from a usb disk, how can i restore to default settings via terminal!?
any one!
i've change setting from a usb disk, how can i restore to default settings via terminal!?
what settings, it'll depend
what settings :)
i've clicked on the icon that was in the desktop and change something cause it was saying that i've no permission to write on it
know i can't mount it anymore :(
, do you remember what you changed. The mount point, maybe?
it was the permissions a think, but know it doesn't mount it
it says Invalid mount option when attempting to mount the volume 'DIGIMATE'.
ok. that helps, a sec
how can i restore this!
copy and paste this into a terminal:    gconftool --recursive-unset /system/storage/volumes
solved the problem, how can i write in this disk know!
great!
with the gconf-editor i've found the problem. can i write to this fat32 usb disk?
you should.
but says that i don't have permissions
delete everything under volumes in the gconf-editor
says "You do not have permissions to write to this folder."
done, only default values know
unmount the drive, and stick it back in.
ping
